comments:
Definition an usage of an own deployment for 'Automated GUI Recording' doesn't work properly. I just can't use my own deployment.
If i select my testsuite and for this my deployment, Eclipse uses the default-deployment.
If i choose a testcase and select a deployment, i get this Error:"IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems:Failed to retrieve the context that should be used to run the test cases in".

If i want to start a test for an external Workbench (Intershop Enfinity Studio, which based on Eclipse) i get an the following error:

I hope you can help with this problem because it is essential for testing the GUI of our product.

Tested with http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/?buildId=TPTP-4.5.0M3 with success.  You can select your own deployment when running an AGR test suite.  Note, make sure the deployment contains a workbench location.

Sorry Paul, unfortunately I submitted the wrong part from the log. This one contains the exception that caused the trouble:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.test.core 4 0 2007-11-27 08:17:45.843

	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$2.run(TestExecutionHarness.java:750)

Hi,

I am suspecting that you did not set the eclipse launch path in the deployment location.  Please confirm that you had set this per Paul's last comment.  

This is how it is done:

Open the location file > Click the 'General Properties' link > Click on Add > Specify 'ECLIPSE_STARTUP_PATH' as the property name > 	Specify the full path of the launch jar file of the Eclipse workbench as the property value, click  OK.

The path will be something like this:
../eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.100v2007xxxx

Hi DuWayne,

thank you for your help.

Hi,

After glancing at the code and the exception, the reason for this error is not obvious to me.  I would suggest running this test on the local machine you are using instead of a remote deployment to see if you get the same problem.

I am really busy this week, so, if this does not yield results and Paul doesn't have further suggestions or advice (he is very busy also), it may be next week before I can look at it further.

DuWayne

In TPTP 4.5, the AGR was moved from a Technology Preview component to an As-Is component. As-Is components are primarily provided for prior users but imply no support (for example, defects, news group, and mailing lists) or commitment to triage or resolve opened defects. For this defect to be considered, please re-open with an attached patch including code to resolve the symptom and test cases to test the fix.
